holidays.name: Eat Your Vegetables Day
holidays.description: A tasty reminder to eat more veggies and embrace those greens! This day encourages everyone to add more vegetables to their plates, celebrating the health benefits and delicious flavors of veggies.
holidays.origin: Started as a health awareness initiative to combat poor eating habits and promote well-being through a veggie-rich diet.
holidays.funFact: Despite the love for junk food, many people find creative ways to make vegetables fun‚Äîlike veggie noodles, cauliflower pizza crust, or hidden veggies in smoothies!

holidays.name: World Juggling Day
holidays.description: A fun tribute to jugglers around the globe. People showcase juggling skills and teach others this entertaining and coordination-boosting art form.
holidays.origin: Created by juggling enthusiasts to celebrate and spread the joy of juggling, promoting physical activity and performance art.
holidays.funFact: The first World Juggling Day was celebrated in 2004, and now thousands participate worldwide, from beginners tossing tennis balls to pros with flaming torches!

holidays.origin: Started as a fun food observance to encourage consumption of peas as a nutritious and tasty vegetable.
holidays.funFact: Peas have been cultivated for over 5,000 years and were a favorite of ancient civilizations, including the Egyptians and Romans!

holidays.name: Russian Independence Day (Finland)

holidays.origin: Tied to historical declarations and regional independence movements in the early 20th century.
